title: Quality Management Strategies for Blended Learning-Based Distance Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational operations experience and digital tool proficiency, foundational language education theory (grammar, vocabulary, expression) comprehension
context.additional_context: Designed for language education practitioners, this program strengthens capacity to establish quality management systems in blended learning environments, particularly focusing on measuring and improving language learning effectiveness in digital contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the four-phase quality management framework (plan-design-implement-evaluate) to language education content in blended learning design
Learners can analyze language learner engagement data (text interaction, pronunciation accuracy, task completion) using cloud-based tools and propose improvement strategies
Learners can explain methods for operating real-time feedback systems based on formative assessment results (grammar accuracy, lexical diversity, expressive fluency)

Learners design quality maintenance mechanisms (monitoring/coaching/support) for large-scale language learning environments (100+ learners), set at least three language learning quality indicators (e.g., discussion participation ≥80%, pronunciation satisfaction ≥4.0/5.0, writing completion rate ≥90%), and propose implementable solutions within six months
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
